review: This is a cool device, no-doubt.  It worked great at home, where I had a wireless network with internet access.  I liked several of the built-in options, including Netflix, very much.  But, I didn't buy this for home...I bought this to use on my boat, to couple movies from my iPhone to my HD-TV.  The Apple-TV won't connect to the iPhone without both devices being on the same WiFi subnet. Nor would the Apple-TV connect to the iPhone's personal hotspot (well, the Apple-TV does connect to the internet, but the iPhone and Apple-TV aren't on the same subnet and won't communicate... STUPID).  So, I bought a wireless router, installed it on my boat... Apple-TV would then connect to the iPhone, but Apple-TV won't work without internet access to verify your phone's movies... STUPID.  Once again, because the iPhone's WiFi hotspot is a different subnet than the iPhone's internet (4G) connection, the two won't work together.  It's such a stupid design that it can't be accidental, Apple had to have done this on-purpose.If you're looking to use this at home, where you have WiFi and you have internet access, this thing is pretty cool.  Try to do something a little different, and this product loses its mind.  I returned mine and bought a Lightning Digital AV Adapter cable, much happier now!
author: Michael Edick "edickent"

review: Typical Apple product - it just works.  I have an Apple network and all Apple devices (iPads, iPhones, Airport Express, Time Capsule, iMac, Mac Mini, etc.).  Plugged it in, turned it on and in a few minutes I was on my secured network.I am thinking of hooking up a Bluetooth keyboard, because with the slowness of the hunt/peck alphabet input built into the Apple TV, it's a pain typing more than a few letters.I also set this up to control with Remote on several iOS devices.  That feature works nicely.This is hooked into a Samsung 46" LED TV via HDMI (had to but that cable separately, which seems odd).  In the future I'll hook up a sound bar to beef up the sound and drive the sound from the optical out.
